value.name: DA Jason Williams defends decision to try 15-year-old murder suspects as adults
value.description: District Attorney Jason Williams responded to criticism two days after his decision to try two 15-year-old boys in adult court for allegedly killing a 52-year-old woman who was shot following a failed car-jacking attempt in New Orleans East.

value.name: Honor and sacrifice: Washington City officers honored for taking on the challenges of the last year
value.description: While officers throughout Washington City converged for an awards ceremony last Wednesday with the intent of recognizing outstanding performance, a large focus of the evening was dedicated to the challenges many faced and the fallen officers left in the wake of 2020.

value.name: Grand injury indicts juvenile suspects as adults in January murder case
value.description: New Orleans District Attorney Jason Williams announced two 15-year-olds accused of killing a 52-year-old woman and her dog in January before stealing a car at gunpoint will be charged as adults. A grand jury indicted the teens on second-degree murder and armed robbery charges Monday.

value.name: NOPD compiles list of cops with credibility issues at DA's request
value.description: That includes whether police involved in the case have a record of misconduct that could call their credibility into question. A 1972 ruling in Giglio v. United States leaned on that precedent. Police departments and district attorneys have since kept updated Brady lists or Giglio lists so prosecutors could share when an officer's integrity has been in doubt.

value.name: Yarroweyah man allegedly found with Viagra and steroids bailed
value.description: A Yarroweyah man allegedly caught with Viagra and steroids has been granted bail at Shepparton Magistrates’ Court. Ashley Ciccone's application for bail was granted without police opposition, despite him needing to show exceptional circumstances to be given bail.
